# Press round-up from ShareCast

No news or research item is a personal recommendation to deal. Hargreaves Lansdown may not share ShareCast's (powered by Digital Look) views.

Jefferies upgrades Anglo American to 'buy'

Fri 29 November 2024 09:33

(Sharecast News) - Jefferies upgraded Anglo American to 'buy' from 'hold' on Friday and lifted its price target to 2,850p from 2,500p following the recent share price decline.

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/jefferies-upgrades-anglo-american-to-buy)

Friday newspaper round-up: House sales, fuel prices, The Telegraph

Fri 29 November 2024 07:29

(Sharecast News) - House sales are expected to accelerate over the next four months as buyers seek to benefit from tax breaks that are due to run out in April 2025, according to the online property website Zoopla. The number of home sales increased across

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/friday-newspaper-round-up-house-sales,-fuel-prices,-the-telegraph2)

Friday newspaper round-up: House sales, fuel prices, The Telegraph

Fri 29 November 2024 07:29

(Sharecast News) - House sales are expected to accelerate over the next four months as buyers seek to benefit from tax breaks that are due to run out in April 2025, according to the online property website Zoopla. The number of home sales increased across

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/friday-newspaper-round-up-house-sales,-fuel-prices,-the-telegraph)

Thursday newspaper round-up: Stellantis, The Observer, car production

Thu 28 November 2024 07:20

(Sharecast News) - The owner of Vauxhall told investors that it was "confident" it would meet the UK's rules on electric vehicle sales just two months before it blamed them for the decision to close a factory in Luton, the Guardian can reveal. Stellantis

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/thursday-newspaper-round-up-stellantis,-the-observer,-car-production)

Wednesday newspaper round-up: Bookies, water companies, John Lewis

Wed 27 November 2024 07:24

(Sharecast News) - Bookmakers and casinos will be forced to fund NHS services that tackle problem gambling, after Labour rubber-stamped the previous government's plans, which also include a cap of as little as £2 on the sums that can be staked on online

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/wednesday-newspaper-round-up-bookies,-water-companies,-john-lewis)

Tuesday newspaper round-up: FCA, bookies, BDO

Tue 26 November 2024 07:22

(Sharecast News) - Britain's financial sector watchdog is "incompetent at best, dishonest at worst", according to a damning report by MPs and Lords which called for a big shake-up. An examination of the Financial Conduct Authority, which took almost three

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/tuesday-newspaper-round-up-fca,-bookies,-bdo)

Monday newspaper round-up: Tourist tax, Amazon, FCA

Mon 25 November 2024 07:27

(Sharecast News) - Millions of tourists to the UK could soon be asked to pay a local visitor levy as cash-strapped councils try to raise money to fund services. Nearly half of Scotland's local councils are considering a mandatory levy on overnight stays,

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/monday-newspaper-round-up-tourist-tax,-amazon,-fca)

Sunday newspaper round-up: Nationwide, Close Brothers, Gold

Mon 25 November 2024 00:13

(Sharecast News) - Nationwide will announce a £2bn gain on its £2.9bn takeover of Virgin Money in its half-year results, this Wednesday, likely triggering a windfall for its customers. The building society will also turbo-charge investment in the combin

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/sunday-newspaper-round-up-nationwide,-close-brothers,-gold)

Friday newspaper round-up: Thales, energy price cap, The Observer

Fri 22 November 2024 07:25

(Sharecast News) - New inheritance tax rules for farmers could be changed to make it easier for those 80 and over to hand down their farm without it incurring the tax, in what would be a partial climbdown by the government after a bruising row with farmer

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/friday-newspaper-round-up-thales,-energy-price-cap,-the-observer)

Thursday newspaper round-up: Energy suppliers, Tokamak Energy, RedBird IMI

Thu 21 November 2024 07:21

(Sharecast News) - Energy suppliers will spend £500m helping customers with their energy bills this winter, after the government helped broker a deal involving 12 of the biggest companies in the UK. Suppliers will spend the money in a variety of ways, in

[](https://www.hl.co.uk/shares/stock-market-news/press-round-up/thursday-newspaper-round-up-energy-suppliers,-tokamak-energy,-redbird-imi)

More articles 

## This website uses cookies

To help personalise your experience with HL and show you relevant content and adverts, we use cookies. 

By clicking "Accept All Cookies", you consent to our use of cookies. You can change this at any time. If you want to know more, read our [cookie policy](/cookie-policy). 

Cookie Settings  Accept All Cookies You have accepted all cookies

## Cookie settings

To make sure you get the most from our website, we use cookies.

Accept All Cookies You have accepted all cookies

#### Essential Cookies

These allow our website to work properly and gives us anonymous information about how the website is used. 

####  Functional cookies 

The website will remember you (for example, for faster login) and help us understand how you use the site. 

On

Off

####  Marketing cookies 

You'll see tailored adverts. If you turn these off, you will still see adverts but they may not be relevant to your interests. 

On

Off

Save preferences 

Find out more about how we use [cookies](/cookie-policy)
